cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then west-southwest, expected to cross the southern North Carolina coast near Wilmington/Bald Head Island on Friday and then meander slowly inland across eastern-central South Carolina before curving northward through the Appalachians toward the mid-Atlantic (including Virginia).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern North Carolina coast near Wilmington/Bald Head Island

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watch presently in effect for the Virginia coast; the nearest Storm Surge Watch is from north of Duck NC to the NC/VA border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of North Carolina, South Carolina, and southeastern Virginia (including Hampton Roads and the lower Chesapeake Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with occasional gusts near 50 kt possible Friday into Saturday; sustained hurricane-force winds are unlikely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible at the mouth of Chesapeake Bay and the lower James River, leading to minor to moderate coastal flooding around the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain (locally higher) possible across southeastern Virginia, producing flash-flood potential and river rises that could hinder port operations.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents, minor tornado threat in outer rainbands, prolonged swell that can disrupt pilot transfers and container operations.
